text: Hey all! We are new to HubSpot and, even though we’ve done a lot of research, we couldn’t find a way to implement our SEO strategy using subdirectories (instead of subdomains). In other words, we would like to foster the reputation of our “www.” subdomain, having “/blog/[CONTENT]” in our posts. Did someone manage to work like this using HS CMS or HS Mkt Hub? thanks! cc <@U043NMX0JDN>
Hi <@U042Z5G4HCK> you would just set this in your blog settings here
Excelent! But then, the main page could be deployed as a single page in the CMS?
yes, that would be your listing template
and all of your posts would be /blog/blog-post-name
Sorry to ask, but in which plan are you (both in CMS and in the marketing hub)?
are you using Free or Starter for CMS?

You should still be able to do the above (IIRC) as our free CMS tools allow you to have one blog and up to 25 website pages.

So you could have `<http://www.example.com|www.example.com>` and have that be one of the 25 pages on your site, then create a blog at `/blog/`  per the area that Jennifer mentioned and your posts should then sit under that sub-directory.

Excelent. It’s just odd because we are not able to do date with our own codebase… Do you know if this may be the issue? As the website is already development, migrating only the codebase to the free CMS would be a great timesaver (so far it has only one page)

Ah I see what you are saying, so HubSpot is not a server host like you would do with something like GoDaddy's hosting (or somewhere else). However, there is a chance that we may have a theme or two in our marketplace that would match up to what your design might be (or you could roll your own, just might have to incorporate our templating language into it).

If you dont mind me asking, what is the current development being done on (the platform you would be migrating from)?
